Subject: Weekly State of the Market - Livestock (2025-09-16)

Livestock

Executive Summary

The latest Commitments of Traders (COT) data for Livestock indicates a predominant bullish sentiment among speculators, particularly notable in Feeder Cattle and Live Cattle. While speculative interest is increasing across the board, commercial hedgers exhibit nuanced positioning, creating specific opportunities and risks for the upcoming week.

Key Opportunities

  • Feeder Cattle Bullish Breakout: Speculators are aggressively increasing net-long positions, while commercials are simultaneously reducing their net-short exposure. This alignment signals strong potential for further upward price movement with diminishing hedging resistance.
  • Live Cattle Continued Momentum: Speculative net-longs are expanding, coupled with commercials reducing their bearish hedges. This supportive environment suggests sustained bullish price action for the near term.

Key Risks

  • Lean Hogs Hedging Resistance: Despite growing speculative long interest, commercial hedgers are actively increasing their net-short positioning. This divergence indicates potential price resistance and a cap on rallies as hedgers anticipate future price declines.

Asset Class Summaries

Lean Hogs

  • Speculators: Dominantly bullish, increasing net-long positions to +53,178 contracts (up 7,283 WoW).
  • Commercials: Heavily net-short at -138,429 contracts, with a notable increase in net-short exposure WoW (up 1,700 contracts). They are taking a counter-position to speculators.
  • Implication: Speculative bullishness is met with growing commercial hedging pressure, suggesting a challenging environment for significant upward price momentum.
  • Flow of Money: Growing speculative conviction countered by increasing commercial bearish bets.

Live Cattle

  • Speculators: Strongly bullish, expanding net-long positions to +90,245 contracts (up 1,762 WoW).
  • Commercials: Net-short at -124,648 contracts, but notably reducing their net-short exposure WoW (down 2,905 contracts), becoming less bearish.
  • Implication: Robust speculative conviction is reinforced by commercials easing their bearish stance, supporting potential for continued price appreciation.
  • Flow of Money: Consistent speculative buying with diminished hedging resistance from commercials.

Feeder Cattle

  • Speculators: Extremely bullish, boosting net-long positions to +26,263 contracts (up 1,593 WoW), maintaining very low short interest.
  • Commercials: Net-short at -9,743 contracts, significantly reducing their net-short exposure WoW (down 1,475 contracts). This indicates a strong shift away from bearish hedging.
  • Implication: Unanimous alignment towards bullish price action as speculators build long positions and commercials actively step back from bearish hedges.
  • Flow of Money: Strong speculative inflows are met with commercial short covering, setting the stage for potential upside.
